sentence.Network_en: Their warheads are enough to obliterate the world several times over.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们拥有的弹头足以将世界毁灭好几次。

sentence.Network_en: There was time enough to obliterate memories of how things once were for him.
sentence.Network_cn: 时间足以抹去他对过去经历的记忆。

sentence.Network_en: Anne was eager to obliterate her error.
sentence.Network_cn: 安妮极想忘却她的错误.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin obliterat- 'struck out, erased', from the verb obliterare, based on littera 'letter, something written'

entry.def: If something obliterates an object or place, it destroys it completely.

example.ex: Their warheads are enough to obliterate the world several times over...
example.tran: 他们拥有的弹头足以将世界毁灭好几次。

example.ex: Whole villages were obliterated by fire.
example.tran: 整座整座的村庄都被大火所吞噬。

entry.def: If you obliterate something such as a memory, emotion, or thought, you remove it completely from your mind.

example.ex: There was time enough to obliterate memories of how things once were for him.
example.tran: 时间足以抹去他对过去经历的记忆。

means.word_mean: 1. mark for deletion, rub off, or erase;

sentences.sentence: "kill these lines in the President's speech"

means.word_mean: 2. make undecipherable or imperceptible by obscuring or concealing;
3. remove completely from recognition or memory;

sentences.sentence: "efface the memory of the time in the camps"

means.word_mean: 4. do away with completely, without leaving a trace

auth_sentence.content: Here, shrewdly selected exceptions obliterate the rule.
auth_sentence.res_content: Here, shrewdly selected exceptions obliterate the rule.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Here, shrewdly selected exceptions obliterate the rule.

auth_sentence.content: Hillary said, We will obliterate them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hillary said, We will obliterate them.

auth_sentence.content: The chatter of police radios in the background can obliterate normal conversation.
auth_sentence.res_content: The chatter of police radios in the background can obliterate normal conversation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The chatter of police radios in the background can obliterate normal conversation.

stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+al……的→adj.文字[上]的;字面的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 文学上的,文学的;精通文学的,从事写作的
stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+ary……的→adj.文学上的,文学的;精通文学的,从事写作的
il不+literacy[n.有文化,有教养,有读写能力]→没有文化→文盲

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有文化,有教养,有读写能力
stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+acy性质,状态→n.有文化,有教养,有读写能力
liter文字,字母+ati表复数→文字人→文人学者
obliterate[v.涂掉,擦掉]+ion表名词→n.涂去, 删除
ob倒,去掉+liter文字,字母+ate表动词→去掉文字→擦掉

sentences.cn: 那场沙暴使他的脚印完全消失了。

sentences.en: The village was obliterated in the bombing raid.
sentences.cn: 这个村庄在轰炸袭击中被完全毁灭了。
